page.title: 03(CONT.) ASTLEY (NOT ON MAP)
page.content: The eastern boundary of Astley is formed by the{RIVER SEVERN,}but as the land between the B4196 and the Severn is not in this block a very brief description only of the area must suffice. { { ASTLEY BURF}is a sizeable hamlet which grew up as a result of the ferry-crossing at{HAMPSTALL}and the {HAMSTALL INN}is still a popular venue. Recent building has almost doubled the population of The Burf and a{vineyard} has been established there as a commercial concern. Further North up the Severn lies the {SEVERN VALLEY SAND AND GRAVEL QUARRY } and the {SEVERN ARTSTONE CO.}which deals in pre-cast concrete. These two give employment to many local people. Nearby is a system of caves known as {REDSTONE CAVES,}reputedly an {ancient Hermitage. }
